conclusion: The y-axis represents velocity (v) in meters per second (m/s) and the x-axis represents time (t) in seconds (s).
Positive velocity indicates motion in the positive direction, and negative velocity indicates motion in the opposite (negative) direction.
From the graph, between 2 and 3 seconds, the velocity is negative (below the time axis).
A negative velocity indicates that the particle is moving in the direction opposite to the defined positive direction.
The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
